page.title: 13HOUSING IN STOCKSBRIDGE
page.content: THE MAJORITY OF THE HOUSING IS EITHER TERRACED OR SEMI DETACHED,WITH A NUMBER OF NEWER DETACHED AREAS AND TWO SETS OF FLATS. FARM BUILDINGS ARE EVENLY SCATTERED THROUGH THE AREA EXCEPT ON HIGH MOORS. A NUMBER OF THESE HAVE BEEN ENGULFED IN URBAN AREAS. THE HOUSING HAS SPREAD UP FROM THE STEEL WORKS AND ALONG THE MAIN ROAD. THE LAST MAJOR DEVELOPMENT WAS IN THE SIXTIES, BOTH PRIVATE AND PUBLIC SECTORS. OLDER AREAS ALONG THE MAIN ROAD HAVE RECENTLY BEEN DEMOLISHED. THERE ARE PLANS TO REDEVELOP CERTAIN AREAS WHILST OTHERS HAVE BEEN LANDSCAPED AND PLANTED. THE HOUSES IN BOLSTERSTONE ARE MOSTLY NINETEENTH CENTURY AND MADE FROM LOCAL STONE.
